questions.question: Does the mirror retain its rectangular shape with illuminated edges?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the mirror on the wall is clearly visible with a rectangular shape. The edges of the mirror have illumination coming from them, which is indicated by the glowing border around the mirror. This visual feature is consistent with a rectangular mirror with illuminated edges.

questions.question: Is the bowl-style vessel sink still present on the countertop?
questions.explanation: In Image B, on the countertop beneath the mirror, there is a bowl-style vessel sink. This is a circular, basin-like sink that is placed on top of the counter, which matches the description of a bowl-style vessel sink.

questions.question: Is the matte black towel rack still attached to the wall on the left side?
questions.explanation: In Image B, on the left side of the countertop, there is a matte black towel rack attached to the wall. This visual element matches the description of the towel rack being present on the left side.

questions.question: Are the decorative vase with branches and small bottle still arranged on the countertop?
questions.explanation: In Image B, on the right side of the countertop, there is a decorative arrangement featuring a vase with branches and a small bottle, which matches the description of these items being placed on the countertop.

questions.question: Is the vanity unit correctly positioned below the mirror with the same white base and natural wood countertop?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the vanity unit is positioned directly below the mirror. It features a white base and a natural wood-colored countertop, consistent with the described setup of the vanity unit below the mirror.
